website_summaries.verdict: The Brother HL-3040CN colour laser printer is cheap and produces impressive results with both text and graphics. But it's quite expensive to run in the long term, so, if you do much printing, you might want to look elsewhere.

customer_reviews.title: Great laser for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Still using this printer after 5 years. Works great. At one time I had trouble with the manual feed when trying to print labels but later it started to work. This is a special touch required to feed the manual paper but with practice you'll master it. Wish it had a lighted information display otherwise it has been a great printer. I've been using generic toner for years and see no difference from the expensive Brother toner. Just be sure to buy OEM toner.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry R

customer_reviews.title: Brother is the best!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Brother Multi-Function printer/scanner/fax at my office for 4 years. The thing is great! We then bought a small Brother monochrome laser printer for our reception desk... flawless! Meanwhile, we have had numerous, top name color laser printers and all have had problems and had terrible customer service experiences.... So I bought this as a replacement. I don't think I'll ever buy another printer except a Brother. Output is typical for a toner-based color laser, but I'm happy after the disastrous experience I've had w/ my 'top-name-brand' wax-based color laser printer. For the few times a month when I need near photo quality output, I just use a Kodak inkjet. For everything else, the Brother is GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Guy in SC

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS PRINTER!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer 1 year and 3 months ago. It has been a pretty good printer. However, the printer stopped working and displayed the error "Print Unable 73". I googled this and tried a few things to no avail. I contacted the company, and they said since it was over a year old, it was no longer under warranty. Then they gave me a list of authorized services providers. I would have to contact one and pay then to come fix my printer. So, I guess I paid $270 for a printer that worked for a year. I won't be purchasing brother products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Squark

customer_reviews.title: Great Home Network Printer
customer_reviews.text: Setting the printer up as a network printer on our home network was very straight forward. Text and graphics printing is very good for the price of this printer. The only con is having to purchase more memory for the printer, as it will not print a medium size graphics file with the memory shipped with the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Bobsgarage

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer - when on Sale Great Price
customer_reviews.text: OfficeMax was advertising this for $179. Amazon was higher, but when I checked later they were at the same price. Bought from Amazon - Great deal. Very good quality printout. Reasonably fast. Good color - not inkjet quality but it is a laser and for the price what more can you ask for.
customer_reviews.author: Papa D

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Color Printer is working fine, it's been used every day now for 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Aldo S.

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is by no means a top of the line toner style printer. I do not run it heavy and I do with is did postscript a little better but for what I paid for this machine is works great and as expected.
customer_reviews.author: B.W.

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: A great product. Does what it says it does and could not be any better. Thank you so much. Will buy from again.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer ever
customer_reviews.text: This printer was highly reconmended by Brother. They said that this printer never break down. Also very good history for not being return. This was my very first time that I ever used Amazon. Everything was perfect. I just place the order in a few seconds and done. If you want to buy from Amazon its quick, easy and shipped fast. I reconmend to anybody who wants to used Amazon. You don't be a computer smart to use Amazon. Thank you Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Dr Jarrett

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse of a printer
customer_reviews.text: We have three of these Brothers in our offices and they last longer and are easier to setup then inkjets. Great for networking as well. Toner is a little expensive, and I've found it easier to just buy another Brother when the drums go bad since the new ones come with a whole new toner supply.
customer_reviews.author: JeepGuy14

customer_reviews.title: satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I myself don't have an experience with the printer. The printer was intended for my husband who is happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah. Devoda

customer_reviews.title: Good product but a little expensive on the ink
customer_reviews.text: I like this product it's solid and straight forward, but it's a little expensive to use if you constantly use the color ink.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Brother color LED printer
customer_reviews.text: The printer is an excellent value. Although it uses LED rather than laser, the quality is comparable. Replacement ink is high, but that is true of any laser printer.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: Good color printer for the price. Toner is pricey. color quality is good. Will only manual duplex.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hummel

customer_reviews.title: not happy with their customer service either
customer_reviews.text: had problems with since opened with the toner, called brother they said this model discontinued, not happy with their customer service either!!
customer_reviews.author: Becky M.

customer_reviews.title: IPv6 Support
customer_reviews.text: This device fully supports IPv6, however out of the box it is configured as IPv6 only. At first installation the user must login using IPv4 via the web interface and check the box to enable IPv6 in the TCP/IP menu.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality. It has been a great printer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Quality. It has been a great printer! Would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Rick R.

customer_reviews.title: Brother Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a good printer however, it should be used for basic printer. It jams quickly with envelopes and thick paper. Otherwise it is fine. I would not recommend for someone one needs it for true business purposes but home/casual use is great.
customer_reviews.author: squareape

customer_reviews.title: Best in value of money
customer_reviews.text: It's a best choice if you look for a LED printer for home or school use... but I cannot say that for business user.
customer_reviews.author: KA'WE

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this color printer after looking for weeks in store. Very easy to set up. The first sheet takes a few extra seconds to print but thereafter sheets print quickly. My personal need is not for speed but for printing large multi sheet jobs. Quality is very good - crisp colors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After 10 years, failing
customer_reviews.text: I got one 10 years ago as "open box." It never did give very good color, and using 3rd party toner, terribly muddy color. Now I think the drums & wipers are wearing out, and there are no spare parts available. Shame I cannot repair it, just as a B&W printer. I see used still being sold for close to $300, and that would be a waste of money since they will be needing parts you cannot get.
customer_reviews.author: angry citizen

customer_reviews.title: 8 Years and Counting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer back in Apr 2012 (from Newegg). The thing is still going strong and has been much more reliable than other small laser printers I've encountered over the years. I was surprised to see it's still available, given how long it's been out ... I recommend this to anyone seeking a reliable printer for the home or individual office. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: hm3

customer_reviews.title: Brother HL-3040CN Compact Digital Color Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for over a year with no problems. The cartridges do not have much toner in them but I have found a local print cartridge shop that can refill for less money. The quality of print is good for business use. No real maintenance to speak of. I keep it off until it is needed and this will preserve its life greatly. Cons: small toner cartridges, and does not give you the high-res photos I would like.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Says it's low on ink when it still has at least 1/3 left.
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these for my office and have regretted it. I've had them for about a year now and seems like I'm always hearing that they are low on toner. It doesn't even tell you which toner is low. If I perform a reset on the toner, I get about half back so I can use it longer. This printer is inexpensive but the toner is way too expensive. I don't reccomend it.
customer_reviews.author: Renita Anderson

customer_reviews.title: A great printer -- if you hate money
customer_reviews.text: I like this printer's performance, but the toner issue is ridiculous. It's out of toner constantly, and we don't print very much. Toner isn't cheap. Most recently, it wouldn't let us print anything in black and white because the yellow toner was low. Spend your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Easy network setup. Connected it via an ethernet cable to my wireless router. Now everyone in the house can print to the laptop wirelessly no problem. I don't print very often so I needed a laser printer - inkjet printer cartridges dry out before I can use them completely. Found it at Staples on clearance for $99 and bought a protection plan for about $20. Replacement toner appears to be reasonably priced and readily available. I would say it is heaver than the 5.5 lbs listed here.
customer_reviews.author: deepseay2k

customer_reviews.title: Annoying attempts to overcharge for toner
customer_reviews.text: I honestly wouldn't recommend this printer. The print quality is nice but Brother tries so hard to suck as much toner money out of you as possible that it becomes frustrating. This printer will completely stop printing as soon as a toner runs low, just so you can get less bang for your buck. Also, after just over a year the fan on my printer runs continuously after printing and I need to hit the power switch on the side of the printer to turn it off. Bottom line: you can do better!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good Solid Color Printer- Upgrade Firmware!
customer_reviews.text: Great printer but heavy with a big footprint in my home office. Major Tip - Download Latest Firmware! Printer showed toner low after 150 copies with the starter toner. Called Brother to complain and they suggested a firmware upgrade and the toner warning disappeared. I printed about 900 mixed color/mono copies before black toner went dead. Don't let it tell you toner is low after just 100 or so pages. Toner is a bit pricey but compatibles should become more available soon.
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: Don't ever buy from Brother!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Brother printers, neither of which works right. One came slightly damaged (the front panel is bent and does not close properly), and could not get it fixed or replaced. And forget about customer "service". You can try - but there is no way you'll actually succeed in speaking to someone at this thieving company. Stay away!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer was very easy to setup on my home network. Installed on 3 systems. The color quality was just fine. I have fed in envelopes and heavy photo paper, and had no problems with paper jams, provided you open the rear exit for heavier forms and envelopes. Have not had that long to evaluate ink usage.
customer_reviews.author: H. Scherer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Color
customer_reviews.text: As a number of other people have noted, the colors are way off on this printer. Anything in your picture that is green will come out in blue on this printer. That is just unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: This printer uses way too much toner!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for a year now, and I don't get nearly the number of pages claimed on the box (much less than half) and once one color is gone, all the cartridges have to be replaced. I will be replacing this with an inkjet printer soon because I can't afford to keep replacing ALL the toner cartridges every few months (with occasional printing). They also don't tell you that if you want to print in high resolution that you need to purchase more memory. I would not recommend this printer to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: bikesncrafts

customer_reviews.title: alignment problems
customer_reviews.text: My only problem with the HL-3040cn is that printing is somewhat out of alignment, which looks bad and can make reading some of its output difficult. The tools to get it into alignment aren't working and Brother hasn't been able to help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible support for Linux / ubuntu
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a nightmare to get to work on Ubuntu. I contacted Brother concerning this and all they do is point you to a printer driver page. Check the web virtually no one is getting this printer to work on Linux.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worse laser printer ever
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRINTER!!! I have had this printer for 6 months and have already had to replace all the toner and the drum units but have only had less than 1000 prints!! This is not covered under warranty, I cannot return the product and I have already spent more in supplies than I did for the printer. Called brother for help, got redirected 3 times and then they sent me what was in the user manual. Useless customer service...even more useless product. DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: reader in pacific

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: This thing jams up so much it isn't usuable. Out of FIFTEEN pages I tried to print I got exactly one, and it was smeared. I wish I never bought this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: A. Schell

product_meta.title: Brother HL-3040CN Compact Digital Color Printer with Networking
product_meta.description: The HL-3040CN is a digital color printer with networking that is ideal for home offices or small offices. It produces brilliant, high-quality output at up to 600 x 2400 dpi resolution with a fast print speed of up to 17ppm in color or black. The HL-3040CN also provides a 250-sheet capacity paper tray and a straight through paper path via its manual feed slot, ideal for printing envelopes and letterhead. Additional features include a built-in Ethernet network interface for printer sharing and a Toner Save mode to reduce toner usage.
feature_bullets: Prints up to 17ppm in color and black
High-quality output at up to 600 x 2400 dpi resolution using Brother’s Digital LED technology
Adjustable 250-sheet capacity paper tray for letter or legal size paper
Straight through paper path via manual feed slot for printing envelopes and thicker media
